DOC.brief_summary: The objective is to evaluate the effectiveness of empiric treatment with cefazolin versus to vancomycin in newborn infants with presumptive clinical signs of hospital acquired bacterial sepsis probably caused by Coagulase-negative staphylococcus. The investigators hypothesized that newborn infants with the presumptive diagnosis of nosocomial sepsis who received cefazolin as empiric treatment would have a clinical outcome not inferior to that of those treated with vancomycin.
DOC.brief_title: Neonatal Suspected Sepsis Treated With Cefazolin or Vancomycin
DOC.criteria: Newborn infants older than three days of life with suspected bacterial sepsis and according to attending physicians, with an indication for initial treatment with vancomycin and at least one blood culture taken prior to receiving the antimicrobial treatment. previous treatment with vancomycin during the week before, infants referred from other hospitals and, upon admission, were being treated with antibiotics.
